There are no two, and there are no two parts.
It's because there's no separation and no elimination.
What then is the reason for this congregation?
The monk said.
'The cognition of all knowables is purified.
There are no dualities, no distinctions, and no interruptions.
Because there's no distinction and no cessation, it's possible.
I'll just take this as my understanding.
The teacher raised his voice and said.
"Take the cat and bring it here.
The monks had nothing to say.
The teacher then shouted it out.
He asked the monk.
"I had a question for you the other day.
You answered me the day before yesterday.
Why are you drowsy now?
The monk said.
'Such and such.'
The teacher said.
"What was the reason?
The monk said.
'No, it's not.'
The master struck him twice, saying.
"One bludgeon struck you like this.
He struck him with one blow, saying, "So it is.
The teacher quickly saw the saṃgha enter.
He then said.
"The buddhas, bodhisattvas, animals, donkeys, and horses.
There's a cypress tree in front of the courtyard.
Three pounds of hemp.
It's a stick of dried dung.
So, you're a shapeless thief.
The monks said.
'I've known for a long time that the monk has this essential point.'
The teacher said.
'I've gone into the wild grass for no reason.
I didn't even know it was the stench of your feces.'
The monk wiped his sleeve and went out.
The master said.
"How miserable is the Buddha?
The teacher had barely seen the saṃgha enter.
He then said, "You won't go out.
The monk then went out.
The next monk entered.
The teacher also said.
"You won't get out!
The saṃgha also got out.
Another monk entered.
The teacher said.
"Two ascetics have just arrived.
One person is liberated and doesn't liberate.
The other liberates and doesn't liberate.
Can you still argue with them?
The saṃgha said.
'I'll take it from you in one piece.'
The teacher said.

source_sentence: 領過後別有甚麼好消息。
translation: 'What's the good news after you've taken it?'
The monk clapped his hands together and left.
The master said.
'Thirty years from now, I'll be awake and gone.'
He asked the monk.
"What's your name?
The monk said, "Fayu.
The teacher said.
"Is the hall of the saṃgha, the Buddha's hall, like that?
The monk said yes.
The teacher said.
"I've been so thoroughly refuted by you, old monk.
The monk proposed.
The teacher then beat him.
He asked the monk.
"Do you still remember what was said?
The monk said.
No, I don't remember it.
The teacher said.
"What do you care if you come here?
He then beat him.
He asked the monk.

source_sentence: 五祖道趙州狗子無佛性。
translation: "The Fifth Patriarch said that Zhaozhou's dog has no buddha-nature.
He's still 100,000 times better than a cat.
What's the answer?
The monk said.
The wind moves, and the grass lies down.'
The teacher said.
'Even you don't talk nonsense.
How did you come to this realization?
The monks were speechless.
The teacher said.
"You're a student of the stream of language.
He then beat them out.
The teacher then saw the monk enter.
He then said.
"The elder Śākyamuni has come.
The monk approached him.
The teacher said.
"Originally, he wasn't here.
He then beat him.
Next, a monk entered.
The teacher also said.
"The elder Śākyamuni has come.
The monk then got out after being confronted and questioned.
The teacher said, "But he seems to be the real thing.
He asked the attendant.
"Many people have entered the room.
How many of them will get attached?
How many didn't? The attendant said.
"I guess I'll just have to look at it.
The teacher extended his hand and said.
'How is my hand like the Buddha's hand?'" the attendant said.
The attendant said.
'It's cold, so I'd like you to pass my sleeve.'
He then went on his way.
The monk then struck a bamboo stick and said.
"Tell me.
'Is this a reward or a punishment?'
Room in the Gifu, Volume 9
